titleInfo.title: Oral history interview with Catherine Berry Pilcher Avery, 1981 February , excerpt 01

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: HNIOHAveryC audio cassette recording converted to mp3 format in 2006.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Catherine Berry Pilcher Avery, conducted on the 09 February 1981 and the 13 February 1981 by Leanne Thornton as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Avery, the great-granddaughter of early Nashville bookstore owner William Tyler Berry and member of the Ladies Hermitage Association, discusses how her aunt, Betsy Bryan Dorris, was involved in the Ladies Hermitage Association. Betsy was married to Duncan R. Dorris, brother of George Preston Dorris, inventor and manufacturer of the Dorris Car. Avery discusses how George P. Dorris came to build the first car in Nashville at his brother's bicycle shop in 1895 and went on to manufacture cars in St. Louis, Missouri, with first the St. Louis Motor Carriage Company and then the Dorris Motor Car Company. The complete interview is available in the repository.

titleInfo.title: Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project
